title: 30 Minutes
body:
You are certain you love the man who will soon be your husband, right?

Plans Or Mistakes

You closed and locked the door behind you in the small room. You were immediately assaulted by hands, mouth and a body that pressed you hard against the wall.“How long until the party starts?” You…

Read more…

summary:
I rounded a corner slowly, raising my gun to my shoulder and firing at the person on the ledge. 
One down. 
I had to find Peter....
body:
I rounded a corner slowly, raising my gun to my shoulder and firing at the person on the ledge.

One down.

I had to find Peter. I continued walking carefully along the path, though it was dark. There was an entrance a few feet in front of me, so I made my way to it. A person jumped out from the shadows, aiming a gun at me. I fired first, smirking to myself.

Two down.

There was a staircase that led to an upper level, cloaked in shadows. If I got onto the top, I could see over the entire area and possibly find Peter quicker.

However, the stairwell was dark and someone could jump out at me and catch me by surprise. I made the decision to move forward and into another room. It seemed to be empty, until I heard footsteps behind me. I whipped around and raised my gun.

“Woah, woah, woah, calm down, soldier.”

I sighed and dropped the gun.

“Pete.” I breathed.

He smirked and winked at me, holding his gun loosely by his side.

“Found ya.”

I rolled my eyes as he made his way over to me, pushing me back into a corner and smiling down at me.

“I almost shot you.” I mumbled.

He shrugged and grinned wider.

“Worth it. You look hot with a gun.” He leaned down and gently pressed his lips to mine. After a moment, he pulled away, keeping his voice at a whisper. “Even if it’s fake.”

He raised his own gun to my chest and pulled the trigger. My vest lit up and beeped, an electronic voice speaking.

“You’re out!”

My jaw dropped and I stared up at him.

“What the hell, Peter?”

He laughed and shrugged again.

“You snooze, you loose, babe.”

I shook my head and dropped the gun to the ground, pulling my vest over my head.

“That’s cheating. I’m never coming here with you again.”

blog.title: Fanfiction, jokes and everything in between
blog.description:
Hey! So i post everything (literally). im part of so many fandoms:
Star Wars, Harry Potter, The flash, Sherlock, One Direction, 5SOS (loads of bollywood related things as well!). And omg I love stand up comedians! you know any good ones please tell me! Im always on the hunt for new friends! Open minded, can talk to me any time. Yeah thats pretty much it lol. Current obsession: Darrow and Darrow plus SUPERNATURAL!!!!. Love all of you, stay unique always!❤💕

tags: Thank you so much for listening to this rant
and im sorry for the long long looooong post
summary: The Harry Potter Series was, is and will forever be a part of me.
title: The Harry Potter Series was, is and will forever be a part of me.
body:
The first time I read the whole (or like most of it) harry potter series I was about in yr6. I read it cause it was there (like seriously, no joke. I read about half the library’s fiction books when I was in yr 5 and 6)


The second time I read it in yr 7, because I wanted to revisit it. for the memories.

That time I learnt how it was kind of related to me in some sense and also got a better handle of the plot, it was also the first time i showed emotion while reading them (albeit small)


The third time I read it in yr 8, to figure out my favourite character (I mean i was a default hermione fan untill about yr 8 when I properly read it and fell in love with fred and george weasley)

and apart from figuring out that my fav characters were infact the weasley twins, i also began understanding the small connection between the books and also felt more attached to the characters. it was also the time when I reached a ridiculous fangirl level to the point where my parents banned me from harry potter. And I also cried like a baby when dumbledore died and when fred died.


The fourth time i read it, was after fully watching the movies, to check for all the inaccuracies that I noticed, and now with a new understanding of pronunciation and characters. 

this time not only did I get new favourite characters (Mcgonagall, snape, luna, bellatrix) apart from the weasley twins (they will always be first), I cried a lot when snape died, fred, tonks, hedwig, lupin, dobby. I cried when hermione was being tortured. I cried that the last thing fred said to george will always be the convo before the warr began. I cried that Teddy will grow up an orphan from the war and I cried that Severus wasnt just a mean spiteful being. that he too could have emotions.  But more importantly, i cried that the series is actually over and nothing can change it. I saw the complex character’s and stories. I felt more into the story than ever. I also noticed the little details. the themes. the beautiful characterisation. It was also then that I took a few lessons from the story and unknowingly applied them to my life. I learnt that not everyone is how they show themself to me. that to be kind no matter what. that humour will always be a light in the darkness. that life goes on, you can either do something or not.


I mean ofcourse I’ve read a book from the series here and there, and they always give me new meaning each time.

But mainly, all i’m trying to say is that. before I start this whole series again. I Just want to state that without these series I don’t know who I would be. Infact without any of the fandoms I’m part of [Supernatural, sherlock, agatha christie, the princess diaries (books), brooklyn nine nine, fantastic beasts, avengers, arrowverse (namely supergirl and arrow and flash)] or obsession i get (loads of bollywood stuff I can name) I dont know Who I would be.

And no matter what other fandoms I become a part of, no matter how old I get, and How complex my life gets. I’ll always have a special place in my heart for Harry potter, It was literally the first fandom I was ever a part of (before I even know what HP was), and HP will always be a part of me and my life.

and apart from figuring out that my fav characters were infact the weasley twins, i also began understanding the small connection between the books and also felt more attached to the characters. it was also the time when I reached a ridiculous fangirl level to the point where my parents banned me from harry potter. And I also cried like a baby when dumbledore died and when fred died.


The fourth time i read it, was after fully watching the movies, to check for all the inaccuracies that I noticed, and now with a new understanding of pronunciation and characters. 

this time not only did I get new favourite characters (Mcgonagall, snape, luna, bellatrix) apart from the weasley twins (they will always be first), I cried a lot when snape died, fred, tonks, hedwig, lupin, dobby. I cried when hermione was being tortured. I cried that the last thing fred said to george will always be the convo before the warr began. I cried that Teddy will grow up an orphan from the war and I cried that Severus wasnt just a mean spiteful being. that he too could have emotions.  But more importantly, i cried that the series is actually over and nothing can change it. I saw the complex character’s and stories. I felt more into the story than ever. I also noticed the little details. the themes. the beautiful characterisation. It was also then that I took a few lessons from the story and unknowingly applied them to my life. I learnt that not everyone is how they show themself to me. that to be kind no matter what. that humour will always be a light in the darkness. that life goes on, you can either do something or not.


I mean ofcourse I’ve read a book from the series here and there, and they always give me new meaning each time.

But mainly, all i’m trying to say is that. before I start this whole series again. I Just want to state that without these series I don’t know who I would be. Infact without any of the fandoms I’m part of [Supernatural, sherlock, agatha christie, the princess diaries (books), brooklyn nine nine, fantastic beasts, avengers, arrowverse (namely supergirl and arrow and flash)] or obsession i get (loads of bollywood stuff I can name) I dont know Who I would be.

And no matter what other fandoms I become a part of, no matter how old I get, and How complex my life gets. I’ll always have a special place in my heart for Harry potter, It was literally the first fandom I was ever a part of (before I even know what HP was), and HP will always be a part of me and my life.
trail.content:
The first time I read the whole (or like most of it) harry potter series I was about in yr6. I read it cause it was there (like seriously, no joke. I read about half the library’s fiction books when I was in yr 5 and 6)


The second time I read it in yr 7, because I wanted to revisit it. for the memories.

That time I learnt how it was kind of related to me in some sense and also got a better handle of the plot, it was also the first time i showed emotion while reading them (albeit small)


The third time I read it in yr 8, to figure out my favourite character (I mean i was a default hermione fan untill about yr 8 when I properly read it and fell in love with fred and george weasley)

and apart from figuring out that my fav characters were infact the weasley twins, i also began understanding the small connection between the books and also felt more attached to the characters. it was also the time when I reached a ridiculous fangirl level to the point where my parents banned me from harry potter. And I also cried like a baby when dumbledore died and when fred died.


The fourth time i read it, was after fully watching the movies, to check for all the inaccuracies that I noticed, and now with a new understanding of pronunciation and characters. 

this time not only did I get new favourite characters (Mcgonagall, snape, luna, bellatrix) apart from the weasley twins (they will always be first), I cried a lot when snape died, fred, tonks, hedwig, lupin, dobby. I cried when hermione was being tortured. I cried that the last thing fred said to george will always be the convo before the warr began. I cried that Teddy will grow up an orphan from the war and I cried that Severus wasnt just a mean spiteful being. that he too could have emotions.  But more importantly, i cried that the series is actually over and nothing can change it. I saw the complex character’s and stories. I felt more into the story than ever. I also noticed the little details. the themes. the beautiful characterisation. It was also then that I took a few lessons from the story and unknowingly applied them to my life. I learnt that not everyone is how they show themself to me. that to be kind no matter what. that humour will always be a light in the darkness. that life goes on, you can either do something or not.


I mean ofcourse I’ve read a book from the series here and there, and they always give me new meaning each time.

But mainly, all i’m trying to say is that. before I start this whole series again. I Just want to state that without these series I don’t know who I would be. Infact without any of the fandoms I’m part of [Supernatural, sherlock, agatha christie, the princess diaries (books), brooklyn nine nine, fantastic beasts, avengers, arrowverse (namely supergirl and arrow and flash)] or obsession i get (loads of bollywood stuff I can name) I dont know Who I would be.

And no matter what other fandoms I become a part of, no matter how old I get, and How complex my life gets. I’ll always have a special place in my heart for Harry potter, It was literally the first fandom I was ever a part of (before I even know what HP was), and HP will always be a part of me and my life.

summary: So Age of Ultron starts out in the middle of fight kinda and when I first saw it I was like 'oh this is kinda weird' but now I...
body: So Age of Ultron starts out in the middle of fight kinda and when I first saw it I was like ‘oh this is kinda weird’ but now I love it. It shows off what the team was like, like what they did when they weren’t busy saving the world. Like imagine Nick Fury coming into the tower and being like 'hey I have a mission for you’ and all their different reactions. Natasha would be the first to respond, she’d jump up and get ready extremely day then sit back down and call Clint. He disappears a lot a couple days at a time, but he always meets them at the airport. Steve would sigh and go get ready 'like a man’ he would say that to Tony everytime because Tony would just press a button and he’d be suited up and just smirk at Steve while he glared back. Steve actually had to manually put on is uniform. Bruce wouldn’t get up Nick would glare and would just groan and say 'i don’t want to get up’ like a teenager, but then Natasha would be like 'get up Mark’ and he would immediately change into his stretchy pants. And that leaves Thor. Thor wouldn’t move, he’d keep watching whatever he’s watching and then on the way there he’d do the lightning bolt thing to get ready. He’s not allowed to do it in the tower anymore. Anyways that’s my version of what happened immediately before Age of Ultron.

summary: please i feel like nat would be like that one victorious episode where jade tells tori she doesn’t sweat because it’s gross...
body:
please i feel like nat would be like that one victorious episode where jade tells tori she doesn’t sweat because it’s gross like

you: ive been getting so sick lately idk what’s going on

nat: huh. thats weird

you: i’m surprised you haven’t come down w anything

nat: me? oh no. i don’t get sick

you: haha that’s a lie everyone gets sick

literally ever single avenger and friday: yeah no not nat

you: ?????

nat: i think being sick is gross so i just don’t get sick
